txt.en: You recount all that you saw to Gondrad and his face slowly twists into a frown.\n\n'I see two reasons to be perfectly miserable, [placeholder]. First and foremost is that these men are truly as numerous, ruthless, and fell as we had feared. And secondly - you found no better reason to turn back and go home without completing the deal.'
The sheer number of arrows and corpses tell a tale of capture by brutal force
You have the ransom Jarl Akhiz demanded for two of Lady Glánhar's sons.
'There is no way out of this, I am afraid. We must march right up to the camp and deliver the ransom... and if we are lucky, walk out with our hides!'
Return to Gondrad just outside the camp at Bâr Nadhron.
Meet Gondrad before Jarl Akhiz's camp at Bâr Nadhron.
'We have both parts of the ransom now, so I suppose we must press on. To Bâr Nadhron, [placeholder], though I have an ill feeling about this!'
Explore the various entrances of Jarl Akhiz's camp in Bâr Nadhron.

'Look at that! This Jarl could certainly take Ost Rimmon. I wonder if he knows it?

'Now, I have been pondering what Lady Glánhar said about caution. Call me coward and cuff me on the ear, but I would scout around the edges of the camp and see what may be seen, if I were you.

'As for myself, this is as close I have courage to go!'
Explore each entrance of the camp ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
The manor of Bâr Nadhron looms above, ruined. The cellar likely lies beneath
Bâr Nadhron has been burnt, and no doubt pillaged, ruthlessly
In short time, the Variags have erected palisades and watch-towers
The Variag camp is fully manned and armed - and well-guarded
'Lady Glánhar bade us to use caution and wit. If stealthily scouting out their camp is not caution, then I am a hapless fool. Well, most likely, I am a hapless fool all the same.'
